intro: Corunastylis densa, commonly known as the dense-stemmed corunastylis, is a herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive floral structures. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically arranged in whorls. Its flowers are usually greenish-white, with three petals and three sepals, and are borne in dense inflorescences. Corunastylis densa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and wetlands.
